docs.lead_paragraph: The cost of claims for people with serious medical conditions has exhausted most of the $5 billion provided by Congress for the health insurance program.

headline.main: Overruns Forcing Lower Payments to Some Providers in Stopgap Health Program
headline.print_headline: Overruns Forcing Lower Payments to Some Providers in Stopgap Health Program

docs.abstract: Obama administration says it is cutting payments to doctors and hospitals after finding that cost overruns are threatening to drain money available in health insurance program for people with cancer, heart disease and other serious illnesses; 135,000 of expected 400,000 have enrolled in program, but cost of claims has far exceeded White House estimates.
docs.snippet: The cost of claims for people with serious medical conditions has exhausted most of the $5 billion provided by Congress for the health insurance program.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: One doctor is going to the front lines in the battle against a new strain of bacterial meningitis affecting New York’s gay community.

headline.seo: For Gay Men, a Fear That Feels Familiar
headline.main: For Gay Men, a Fear That Feels Familiar

docs.abstract: Demetre Daskalakis, doctor and gay activist, is going to the front lines in the battle against new strain of bacterial meningitis affecting New York’s gay community, helping spread the word to vaccinate; seven men have died in New York City, about a third of diagnosed cases, since 2010.
docs.snippet: One doctor is going to the front lines in the battle against a new strain of bacterial meningitis affecting New York’s gay community.

docs.lead_paragraph: Medicine used to be obsessed with eradicating the tiny bugs that live within us. Now we’re beginning to understand all the ways they keep us healthy.

headline.seo: Say Hello to the 100 Trillion Bacteria That Make Up Your Microbiome
headline.main: Some of My Best Friends Are Germs
headline.print_headline: Some of My Best Friends Are Bacteria

docs.abstract: Michael Pollan article notes researchers are just now beginning to understand the ways that microbes, bacteria that live inside humans, helps keep people healthy; says it may be useful to dirty up one's diet by eating more plant-based foods in order to increase exposure to bacteria.
docs.snippet: Medicine used to be obsessed with eradicating the tiny bugs that live within us. Now we’re beginning to understand all the ways they keep us healthy.
